information:
Post Malone has received five nominations for the 60th Academy of Country Music (ACM) Awards, scheduled for May 8, 2025. His nominations include Album of the Year for "F-1 Trillion," and three nominations for his collaboration with Morgan Wallen, "I Had Some Help." He is not nominated for the top category, Entertainer of the Year. Key competitors include first-time nominee Ella Langley, who leads with eight nominations. Other heavily nominated artists are Morgan Wallen and Lainey Wilson with seven nominations each, and Chris Stapleton with six nominations.

The reception for cross-genre artists at country music award shows has been mixed historically. Favorable precedents include Beyoncé winning a CMA Award for a collaboration with The Chicks, and Justin Timberlake winning a CMA with Chris Stapleton. Lil Nas X also won CMA Awards for "Old Town Road." However, many artists crossing over face resistance from traditional voters, and the Album of the Year award typically goes to established country artists. Post Malone himself has a history of receiving numerous Grammy nominations without winning; at the 2025 Grammy Awards, he was nominated for eight awards and lost all of them, bringing his career total to 18 nominations without a win.

Post Malone has recently made high-profile moves into the country music scene. His country album, "F-1 Trillion," has had strong commercial performance. He has engaged in collaborations with established country stars such as Morgan Wallen, Luke Combs, Blake Shelton, and Jelly Roll. His recent performance at the Coachella festival featured a country-focused set and guest appearances from Jelly Roll and Ed Sheeran. However, this performance received a mixed reception from viewers and critics.

forecast.time_left_until_outcome_known: 16 days (awards ceremony is May 8, 2025, and today is April 22, 2025)
forecast.status_quo_outcome: Post Malone does not win any awards at the 60th ACM Awards
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: Traditional country music voters resist awarding an outsider who recently pivoted to the genre. Despite multiple nominations, his entries lose to established country artists in each category. The mixed reception to his country work (like his Coachella performance) reflects broader skepticism from the country music establishment. His pattern continues of receiving nominations without wins, similar to his 0-for-18 Grammy record.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: His collaboration 'I Had Some Help' with Morgan Wallen wins in one of the three categories it's nominated for, given its commercial success and Morgan Wallen's established status (7 total nominations). Alternatively, 'F-1 Trillion' wins Album of the Year due to its strong commercial performance and star-studded collaborations. The ACM voters embrace him as they have previous cross-genre artists like Beyoncé, Justin Timberlake, and Lil Nas X.
forecast.rationale:
With 4-5 nominations, Post Malone has multiple opportunities to win, which significantly increases his chances compared to a single nomination. The most promising path is through his collaboration categories with Morgan Wallen, who is heavily nominated (7 total) and well-established in country music.

Positive factors: (1) Multiple nominations provide several shots at winning; (2) Strong commercial success of F-1 Trillion; (3) Historical precedent of cross-genre winners at country awards (Beyoncé, Justin Timberlake, Lil Nas X); (4) Strong collaborations with established country stars lending credibility.

Negative factors: (1) Not nominated for top category (Entertainer of the Year); (2) Career pattern of 0-for-18 at Grammys suggests awards voters may not favor him; (3) Mixed reception to his country pivot, including his Coachella performance; (4) Strong competition from established artists with more nominations (Ella Langley with 8, multiple artists with 6-7); (5) Potential resistance from traditional country music voters to an outsider.

The forecast is not higher because of Post Malone's track record of not winning awards despite many nominations, the mixed reception to his country work, and strong competition from established country artists. It's not lower because he has multiple nominations (increasing probability of at least one win), successful precedents of cross-genre winners exist, and his Morgan Wallen collaboration is commercially strong.

I would update higher if: new information showed his nominations were in less competitive categories, or polling/predictive markets strongly favored him. I would update lower if: evidence emerged of stronger resistance from country music establishment, or his competitors' entries were receiving much more acclaim.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Post Malone win an award at the 60th Academy of Country Music Awards?

Question background:
The awards are scheduled to be held on May 8, 2025. Malone has 4 nominations.


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Post Malone wins an award at the [60th Academy of Country Music Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/60th_Academy_of_Country_Music_Awards).




Your research assistant's report says:
Post Malone has received five nominations for the 60th Academy of Country Music (ACM) Awards, scheduled for May 8, 2025. His nominations include Album of the Year for "F-1 Trillion," and three nominations for his collaboration with Morgan Wallen, "I Had Some Help." He is not nominated for the top category, Entertainer of the Year. Key competitors include first-time nominee Ella Langley, who leads with eight nominations. Other heavily nominated artists are Morgan Wallen and Lainey Wilson with seven nominations each, and Chris Stapleton with six nominations.

The reception for cross-genre artists at country music award shows has been mixed historically. Favorable precedents include Beyoncé winning a CMA Award for a collaboration with The Chicks, and Justin Timberlake winning a CMA with Chris Stapleton. Lil Nas X also won CMA Awards for "Old Town Road." However, many artists crossing over face resistance from traditional voters, and the Album of the Year award typically goes to established country artists. Post Malone himself has a history of receiving numerous Grammy nominations without winning; at the 2025 Grammy Awards, he was nominated for eight awards and lost all of them, bringing his career total to 18 nominations without a win.

Post Malone has recently made high-profile moves into the country music scene. His country album, "F-1 Trillion," has had strong commercial performance. He has engaged in collaborations with established country stars such as Morgan Wallen, Luke Combs, Blake Shelton, and Jelly Roll. His recent performance at the Coachella festival featured a country-focused set and guest appearances from Jelly Roll and Ed Sheeran. However, this performance received a mixed reception from viewers and critics.

Today is 2025-04-22.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
